headline: Biden to Release 1 Million Barrels of Oil From Reserves Daily to Combat High Gas Prices
sentences:

Find: Gas Cost Fallout: Major Oil Companies Amass $205B in 2021 Profits, Draw Criticism for Not Flipping the Switch Fast Enough
Our prices are rising because of (Russian President Vladimir) Putins actions.

Your family budgets to fill a tank  none of it should hinge on whether a dictator declares war.?
The first part of the plan is to tap into the Strategic Petroleum Reserve to access as much as 180 million barrels, Bloomberg reported.

The release of U.S. reserves accompanies a similar move by the International Energy Agency  which includes the United States and other major economies  to deploy 60 million barrels of oil stockpiles to help ease prices.

Soaring gas prices are a major problem in the United States, and to alleviate the problem, President Joe Biden announced the U.S. is releasing 1 million barrels of oil a day from reserves for the next six months or so.
As GOBankingRates previously reported, half of that deployment will come from the U.S. Strategic Petroleum Reserve, with the rest coming from IEA members in Europe and Asia.
It was established to reduce the impact of disruptions in supplies of petroleum products and to help the U.S. meet its obligations under the international energy program.
Brian Kemp signed a bill that will provide tax refunds of $250 to $500 to the states taxpayers as financial relief against inflation.
According to the Department of Energy website, the Strategic Petroleum Reserve is the worlds largest supply of emergency crude oil.
Prior to the announcement, rumors of the plan sent the price of West Texas Intermediate futures down as much as 5.5% on Thursday.
And the bottom line is if we want lower gas prices we need to have more oil supply right now,? Biden said.
Releasing U.S. emergency oil reserves shows just how desperate the White House is to rein in gas prices.
Ultimately, we and the whole world need to reduce our dependence on fossil fuels altogether.
We need to choose long-term security over energy and climate vulnerability,? Biden said.
